page.title: 08 HOW HARROGATE IS CHANGING
page.content: In recent years a conference centre and conference centre hotel have been built. Special events are organised to attract people at different times of the year:The International Youth Music Festival (Easter),Spring Flower Show (April), Yorkshire Show (July), International Festival (July/August), Antiques Fair(September). Harrogate remains a popular place to visit. Local opinion is divided over the development of the town:many feel the new conference centre;many are angry over the building of a new superstore near the town,which may cause traffic problems; and many feel strongly that the proposed northern bypass will erode the green belt around the town. Whilst the councillors are trying to move with the times,some locals feel the changes are making Harrogate a less attractive place for visitors.
